title: Director of Account Management
description:
**About Artlist: Who Are We?**


Artlist is where the creative arts meet technology. If there’s one thing we all have in common, it’s a love of music and film, which is why we build innovative products to help global brands and individual creators make amazing videos.


We do this by giving them the best music, footage, sound effects, and templates around. We also revolutionized the industry with a radical new music licensing model that has since become the global standard.


Artlist is now the go-to platform for over 26M users worldwide. They range from top-tier global brands like Google, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and Calvin Klein to social creators, video editors, and more.

**Our Products:**

* Artlist: an all-in-one platform for video creation, including high-quality and curated royalty-free music, SFX, footage, templates, plugins, and more.
* Motion Array: the ultimate destination for creators, including high-quality video templates by the world’s top motion designers, presets, plugins, music, SFX, stock footage, graphics for design, motion graphics, and stock photos

**About the Role:**


Ready to join one of the coolest companies around? Artlist is undergoing rapid growth, and we are seeking a Director of Account Management to lead all our existing business activity for the North American Market out of our NYC office. In this pivotal role, you will report directly to the Global Head of Sales and collaborate closely to scale our recurring business, drive upsell opportunities, and enhance our presence among existing customers, ensuring a top-tier experience.


We’re looking for a leader who thrives on challenges, is passionate about developing teams, eager to lead and learn, and is relentless in pursuing success. As the Director of Account Management, you will oversee the performance of our Account Manager teams, develop and implement robust practices, and directly manage several Managers. Your leadership will be crucial in fostering a culture of growth and excellence within our team.


If you’re driven by the challenge of building and leading high-performance teams and excited to spearhead the growth of a new business function, we want to hear from you! Join Artlist and become a key player in shaping our success during this exciting phase of rapid expansion.

**What is in it For You?**

* An amazing office located in the heart of Soho, with a flexible hybrid work environment.
* Leadership that is deeply invested in your career development and success.
* Be part of something big! Play a pivotal role in driving the growth of our rapidly expanding sales team during this exciting time of high growth and innovation.
* Comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance.
* 401(k) with company match.
* Regular team-building experiences, including happy hours and events.
* Complimentary coffee, snacks, and more to fuel your productivity.

**Wake up For This:**

* Own all existing business activity across our North American market including the development of strategic initiatives to enhance our revenue and retention amongst paying customers as well as the execution and performance of the teams on a day to day basis
* Lead, inspire, mentor, coach, and directly manage all the Account Managers Team Managers and support individual Account Managers as needed, providing guidance and support to enhance their performance.
* Cultivate a high-performance, collaborative culture that aligns with Artlist’s mission and values.
* Own the overall sales target and revenue goals for AM teams ensuring consistent retention and growth.
* Develop and implement AM sales strategies to best manage our book of businesses and build additional processes to deepen our ability to close and scale more strategic accounts,
* Proactively lead recruitment, training, and development initiatives aligned with the department’s goals in the pursuit of building a world-class Account Management group.
* Scale existing sales processes and build additional processes and infrastructure flows, including the integration of new software with Salesforce to streamline operations.
* Provide insights to senior leadership for strategic planning and decision-making.
* Foster and maintain strong relationships with key clients, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and loyalty.
* Collaborate with the executive team to drive company-wide initiatives and ensure cohesive execution.
* Work closely with marketing, product, and customer success teams to align sales strategies with overall business objectives.
* Build relationships with key stakeholders across the global organization to achieve both strategic and tactical goals.

  


Requirements:  

  

**Qualifications Required:**

* 4+ years of Account management experience owning a book of business portfolios focusing on retention and expansion/upsells. - Essential
* 2+ years as a front line managers leading Sales Account Managers or AEs - Essential
* 1+ years of sales leadership experience at an upper management or director level managing front line managers - Must
* BA and/or MBA preferred; or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets in a high-paced, hyper-growth environment.
* Experience in working for Product Led Growth companies - Significant plus
* Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.
* Strong customer-facing and presentation skills, with the ability to establish credibility with executive-level clients.
* Proven experience providing executive-level support to Account Executives during calls, helping to navigate procurement, legal, and commercial challenges for renewals and upsell type of deals. - Essential
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Proficiency in sales software such as Salesforce, Salesloft, and Outreach - Plus


This position has a base salary range of $160,000 - $190,000. This salary range is reflective of a position based in New York, New York. Please note that actual salaries are commensurate with experience, and since ARTLIST has a location-based compensation structure, there may be a different range for candidates in other locations.


ARTLIST values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of underrepresented ethnic groups, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. ARTLIST is an equal opportunity employer. Recruitment, hiring, promotions and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment shall be maintained in a manner which does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or military status, or in violation of any applicable Federal, state or local laws. ARTLIST will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation to support the interview process, please contact hr@artlist.io.


ARTLIST will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable State, Local, and Federal laws.

title: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF FINANCE
description:
Summary


At Hyatt, we believe our guests select Hyatt because of our caring and attentive colleagues who are focused on providing efficient service and meaningful experiences. This position is responsible for the oversight of the hotel's general ledger operations and supports the hotel Director of Finance. Additionally, this person will be responsible for efficiently running the Finance department in line with Hyatt Corporate standards while meeting guest and owner expectations. This position is on property role. Other responsibilities will include the following:


* Prepare and review all journal entries, month-end reports and reconciliations


* Review preliminary financial statements with Director of Finance


* Participate in monthly financial reviews and assist Director of Finance with the presentation of these reports


* Assist Director of Finance with supervising Finance staff and the Information Technology functions of the hotel including coaching and counseling colleagues to reflect Hyatt service standards and procedures, interviewing, training and evaluating performance of staff.


* Manage and help oversee hotel on-site accounting functions to ensure proper fiscal management, timely and accurate reporting and analysis for the hotel. This responsibility also includes hotel financial planning, budgeting, accounting and cash management


* Systems administration, G/L account reconciliations, budget preparations, inventories, monthly closings and full P&L responsibility.


* Assist with managing and ensuring SOX compliance


* Assist Director of Finance with completing the year-end audit process. Review and approve all reconciliations and audit work papers. Participate in and respond to auditor requests to ensure total hotel compliance.


* Help prepare all monthly and annual financial statements. Investigate, review and analyze the variance explanations, involving the department staff in this process. Take initiative to manage trouble shooting for respective cost controls and revenue enhancement


* Assist Director of Finance with special reporting and analysis projects



Hyatt colleagues work in an environment that demands exceptional performance yet reaps great rewards. Whether it's career opportunities, job enrichment or a supportive work environment, if you are ready for this challenge, then we are ready for you.


Qualifications

* + Hospitality or Accounting degree preferred
	+ 2 years or more of progressive Accounting experience, preferably in a hotel
	+ Experience supervising Accounting staff members
	+ Prior Micros POS, Kronos Dimensions, Hyperion/Oracle, and Hyatt systems (Opera PMS) expertise desired
	+ Must be an advanced user of Microsoft Word and Excel
	+ Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with people of diverse socioeconomic, cultural, disability, and ethnic backgrounds
	+ Must possess the following strengths: high energy, entrepreneurial spirit, motivational leader, effective communicator, effective in providing exceptional customer service and ability to improve the bottom line
	+ Clear concise written and verbal communication skills in English
	+ Must have excellent organizational, administrative and problem-solving skills

title: Co-Op - Corporate Communications
description:
Job Description
JOB SUMMARY
AMC Networks is home to many of the greatest stories and characters in TV and film and the premier destination for passionate and engaged fan communities around the world.
We create and curate celebrated series and films across distinct brands and make them available to audiences everywhere. Our portfolio includes targeted streaming services AMC+, Acorn TV, Shudder, Sundance Now, ALLBLK and HIDIVE; cable networks AMC, BBC AMERICA, IFC, Sundance TV and WE tv; and film distribution labels IFC Films and RLJE Films. The company also operates AMC Studios, our in-house studio, production, and distribution operation behind acclaimed and fan-favorite originals including The Walking Dead Universe and the Anne Rice Immortal Universe, and AMC Networks International, our international programming business.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES* Corporate PR: identifying and distributing relevant daily press coverage for AMC Networks, its business units and its executives; drafting written materials; preparing mailings.
* Corporate Marketing: maintaining branded merchandise inventory and corporate philanthropy database; assisting with various ongoing special projects.
* Administrative assistance: daily general office assistance for all members of the department; maintaining various departmental tracking documents and subscriptions.


QUALIFICATIONS (Required & Preferred)* Currently be enrolled in an undergraduate program (graduation date later than December 2024)
* Have proven proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams)
* Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Have strong, proven potential leadership skills
* Have excellent attention to detail


The base compensation for this position is $20/hr commensurate with experience. AMC Networks additionally offers a comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drug Coverage, 401k Plan, Wellness Program, Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, Paid Time Off, Paid Parental Leave and Adoption Services, among other benefit plan options, subject to eligibility requirements. AMC Networks values the benefits achieved through in-office collaboration, but we provide our employees with the flexibility to work from home one day per week.*The Company is committed to policy of nondiscrimination in its employment and personnel practices. Applicants are considered for all employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, religion, alienage, citizenship, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, genetic predisposition or carrier status, age, marital status, familial status, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, stalking or sexual assault, sexual* *orientation, disability* *or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
### **Building A Brand Starts With Our Story**



FIRST is a leading global brand experience agency serving clients in various industries, including financial services, technology, new & traditional media, aerospace, healthcare, and professional services. FIRST has received numerous accolades, including being named one of the Top 150 Event Organizers & Agencies in the USA by Eventex, being listed among the "200 Top Marketing Agencies" in 2023, 2022 & 2021 by Chief Marketer, being recognized as one of the "50 Top Event Companies" by Special Events, being included in the Top 100 "Best Places to Work in NYC" by Crain's New York Business, and being listed as one of the "1000 Companies to Inspire Britain" by The London Stock Exchange Group.



Learn more at www.firstagency.com



Our story started over 25 years ago growing through collaboration, innovation, strong culture, and a focus on people, specifically our people. Our people inspired, developed, and grew FIRST to the incredible brand experience creator it is today.



And our hope is that you become the next page of our story in developing how our agency connects more people beyond what they thought was possible.


**A welcoming, creative and ambitious workplace that offers personal and professional growth for all individuals.** At FIRST, you'll find:


* A welcoming workplace that fosters diversity and belonging with a focus on team members feeling valued, respected, and supported.
* Creative teams that enjoy challenging work with an ability to make an impact on those around them.
* An experiential organization that cares about the development and career experience of each employee, focusing on excellence and flexibility with the right balance of structure to thrive.


**Location: New York, NY (Hybrid) Must reside in the tri state area to be able to go into office**


### **What You Would Get To Do**

  


**FIRST** is seeking a **Marketing Coordinator** to support our Marketing team. As a member of the Marketing team, the Marketing Coordinator will promote FIRST's credentials, work, values, and culture to clients and prospects in support of brand and business goals.



As the tasks vary based on projects, deliverables and deadlines, so will the responsibilities of this position. The perfect addition to our team will have solid creative writing skills and should be prepared to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment, often under tight deadlines. Creative collaboration, outside-of-the-box thinking, attention to detail, project management skills, enthusiasm, and self-starting by nature are key assets for this role.


**Your Contributions**


* Support on the day-to-day coordination of the global marketing plan and budget; coordinate and track marketing campaigns mapped on the plan and agreed to by key stakeholders.
* Develop project plans and timelines
* Track all budget items
* Coordinate the development of award submissions, case studies, thought leadership white papers, blogs, social posts, and other written materials.
* Develop project plans and communicate with timelines and deadlines with key stakeholders
* Research and capture insights for thought leadership pieces, competitor reports, and industry outlooks.
* Develop relationships with key industry leaders to identify speaking opportunities
* Monitor industry award opportunities; write first drafts of award submissions and case studies and submit and store final drafts.
* Write social copy and blogs for FIRST website
* Support internal and external marketing events, including supplier and client events and roundtables, industry events, and speaking opportunities.
* Support on internal and external event planning by creating project plans, coordinate invitation lists and outreach, support on copy development, and more.
* Support on digital initiatives, such as maintenance of the FIRST website, social media channels, SEO, and paid ads**.**
* Write content for the FIRST website and social media channels.
* Develop and manage video reels and image library, including storage, organization, and upkeep. Support team members on search engine optimization and paid ad strategies.

 ### **What We Are Looking For**



Please be aware that we know experience does not always look like we describe it. If you believe you would be an excellent fit for this role, please apply - we would love to see how you could fit at **FIRST**. Please contact recruiting@firstagency.com if you need accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process.


* 1-3 years of relevant marketing experience
* Bachelors degree required
* Working knowledge of Google docs, sheets, and slides ·
* Graphics and design software (Canva/Photoshop) experience a plus but not required ·
* Salesforce, Hubspot, Canva, WordPress, and/or other marketing software management experience is a plus, but not required ·
* Basic knowledge of social media tools (LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
* Bachelor's degree required
* Excellent project management skills, including multi-tasking, prioritization of tasks (i.e. time management), attention to detail, and ability to meet strict deadlines ·
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Demonstrate excellent research and organizational skills
* A self-starter able to thrive in a fast-paced environment


**United States Residents**: The base pay for this position ranges from $50,000-$70,000. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus.



#LI-TE1

  

FIRST is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. FIRST is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We stand firm: FIRST will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. If any candidate feels that they are unable to meet the requirements of the role, please get in touch to discuss adjustments or other suitable roles.

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
**Clinical Psychologist**

  


**What We Offer:**


* No Admin Tasks! No cancellations! No no-shows!
* Flexible Daytime Hours
* We offer our clinicians with the support and resources they need to succeed!
* 401(k) Plan for FT or PT employees
* Full Time offers Excellent Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance Benefits
* Full Time offers Vacation/PTO/Holiday Time
* **FT Range: $100,000 – up to $155,000** **annually including base and bonus potential**
* **Now Offering a Sign-On Bonus of $2,500 for Full Time employees after the first 90 days of employment!**
* **Part Time Positions Available and Paid Fee for Service**
* Autonomy-mentality with customized support.
* Commute to one Location a Day!
* Rewarding experiences working with the senior population

  


**About Us:**



Senior Care Therapy is looking for full time and part time clinicians to further our mission of providing **in-person** psychotherapy services to the geriatric population in over 300 sub-acute, long-term care, and assisted living communities throughout NJ, NY, PA, and MD. Are you interested in building meaningful relationships with our residents, and providing quality patient-centered services to help residents navigate the challenges of aging? If yes, we invite you to apply today!

  



SCT is a clinician owned and operated behavioral health company that takes care of all the administrative tasks like billing, insurance, credentialing, and pre certs so you can do what you do best and focus on treatment sessions! In this setting our treatment sessions start with an initial assessment, follow up sessions, and then documentation that is very efficient and all electronic. For this setting the preferred times are daytime hours, because in later evenings this population can be challenging to effectively service. Within this time frame, SCT believes in work-life-balance and flexibility is available in this position. We offer various amounts of support to our clinicians so you can be successful and effective in your role.

  


**Compensation:** Full Time opportunity paid Salary! Part Time paid Fee for Service!


**Schedule:** Day Time Hours, Mon-Friday. Weekends are not Mandatory!

  


**Responsibilities include, but not limited to:**


* Collaborate with the treatment team, interdisciplinary team, and Directors as needed.
* Provide individual and group sessions.
* Help support patients with their issues, concerns, and expectations to reach their goals.
* Conduct initial assessments and follow up sessions during standard hours of care.
* Complete documentation within appropriate guidelines using our electronic medical/health system.
* Take responsibility for professional development and meeting licensure requirements to maintain credentials through attendance at relevant workshops and seminars.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Experience working with a geriatric population is a plus.
* History of treating Anxiety, Depression and Adjustment Disorders.
* Previous clinical experience in Skilled Nursing, Hospital, Hospice, or Home Care setting is a plus.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Computer proficiency.

  


**Job Requirements:**


* Willingness to travel up to 45 minutes
* Full Vaccination and Booster Status may be required in some facilities
* Ability to communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in writing

  


**License Requirements:**



Possession of any of the following licenses in the state in which you've applied is required


* Clinical Psychologist (Ph.D, Psy.D, or EdD)

  



SCT welcomes individuals with a variety of licensure types to join our exceptional team. Don't see your license listed above? We encourage you to reach out directly to learn more about current openings! Currently Hiring for Clinical Psychologist, LCSW, LMHC, and LMFT located in NJ, NY, PA, or MD.


Senior Care Therapy is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.



This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Senior Care Therapy makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

title: Weekend Nanny Needed in Tribeca 3-4 Weekends per Month #495
description:
*A Nanny Match is a unique nanny placement service that matches warm, loving & highly qualified nannies with families through a customized placement process. We emphasize safety, compatibility, and a mindful matchmaking process.*

***Applicants must apply on our website to be considered for the position www.anannymatch.com/nannies/.*****If you have already been vetted by our agency, please do not apply to this job posting. Reach out to us directly with your interest.**

Location: Tribeca, NYC

Ages of children: 3 month old (b) and a sometimes (partial custody) a 5 year-old (g)

Start date: As soon as they find the right fit!

**General schedule: Guaranteed minimum of 50 hours per month. The nanny will likely have 1 weekend off per month, although the 50 hours may be distributed among 4 weekends during some months.** 

**Flexibility is needed. The schedule will be provided at least 2 weeks in advance.**

The family travels quite a bit, and they can guarantee 4 weekends per month to a nanny who can travel with them.

Preference will be given to a nanny who can spend occasional overnights in the city or travel on occasion.

**The position starts as soon as possible.** 

**The Ideal Candidate:**

* This position is ideal for a person seeking a steady, long-term weekend position with a family with which they can grow—someone with a warm and positive attitude who can bring a sense of calm to the home.
* A Nanny with significant experience working with infants and toddlers, and is knowledgeable about children’s development & genuinely loves caring for them.
* Flexible with scheduling on weekends.
* Emotionally regulated and attuned to the children’s needs but can also enforce boundaries when needed.
* While not a requirement for the role, the family would love to work with a candidate who speaks Spanish.

**Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Actively engaging the children in fun, age-appropriate activities.
* Supporting the achievement of age-appropriate milestones (e.g. transitioning to solids, learning to walk, potty training, etc). Tummy time, reading, etc.
* Taking the children to activities and playdates.
* Diaper changes and supporting healthy hygiene.
* Bottle feedings and the sterilization of the bottles and equipment.
* Maintaining the child’s nap and eating schedules.
* Children's laundry.
* Meal preparation for the children.
* Keeping the home's main spaces and the child’s room clean and tidy.

**Requirements:**

* 3+ years of relevant nanny experience with infants.
* Experience with school-aged children.
* Legally permitted to work in the U.S.
* 2-3 relevant references.
* Resides within a reasonable commuting distance from Tribeca.

**Compensation: The hourly rate starts at $30.00 per hour or higher, depending on the right candidate's experience, flexibility, and credentials.**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: From $30.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends only

* Do you understand that you must apply on our website to be considered for the position?
* Are you flexible with scheduling needs on the weekends?
* Are you able to make a long term commitment?

Experience:

* school age children: 1 year (Required)
* nanny: 3 years (Required)
* infant: 3 years (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Unit Manager
description:
**About us**

optima care at castle hill is a small business in Union City, NJ. We are professional, agile, innovative and our goal is to provide the best care possible to the best of our abilities while adhering to the rules and regulations put forth by the state.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Food provided
* Safe work environment
* Lively atmosphere
* On-the-job training

```Job Summary```

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Unit Manager to join our medical team. As a Unit Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the operations and staff of a specific unit within our medical facility. Your role will involve managing a team, ensuring high-quality patient care, and maintaining a safe and efficient working environment.

```Duties```

- Manage and supervise the daily operations of the unit

- Provide leadership and guidance to nursing staff and other healthcare professionals

- Develop and implement policies and procedures to ensure compliance with healthcare regulations

- Monitor patient care activities to ensure adherence to quality standards

- Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare providers to optimize patient outcomes

- Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback to staff members

- Assist in the recruitment, hiring, and training of new staff members

- Oversee the maintenance of patient records and documentation

```Requirements```

To be successful in this role, you should possess the following qualifications:

- Previous experience in team management within a medical office or healthcare setting

- Knowledge of medical terminology, ICD-9 coding, and other relevant healthcare practices

- Familiarity with neonatal ventilators, infection control protocols, critical care procedures, and pediatric care

- Strong organizational and communication skills

- Ability to multitask and prioritize responsibilities effectively

- Excellent problem-solving abilities

- Attention to detail and accuracy in recordkeeping

Please note that a background check, physical examinations, and other pre-employment screenings may be required for this position.

If you are a dedicated healthcare professional looking for an opportunity to make a difference in patient care while leading a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply for the position of Unit Manager.

title: Sales Specialist
description:
**About Uhomes.com:** Uhomes.com is a leading online platform dedicated to providing tools and comprehensive property listings to enhance the property hunting experience for our users. Our mission is to bridge the gap between physical property exploration and virtual reality, offering an immersive and convenient way for users to explore properties from the comfort of their homes.

**Job Description:** This Sales Specialist will be on the front lines of growing our North American business by serving students from diverse countries. The role requires strong communication skills, sharp analytical abilities, critical thinking, and effective execution, along with the interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams. In our fast-paced environment, we seek a highly adaptable candidate who can seamlessly shift between long-term strategic initiatives and swift, tactical actions as needed.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead the North American region, become a regional expert and train team members.
* Maintain relationships with property owners and become a property expert for specific regions.
* Converts prospects and leads into bookings to meet targeted leasing goals.
* Plan and organize daily activities to optimize time and achieve target booking numbers.
* Analyze customer insights, consumer trends, market data, and marketing best practices to develop effective strategies.
* Recruit and train group leaders, student ambassadors to help expand sales distribution channels.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, real estate or a related field.
* **Fluency in both Mandarin (Chinese) and English is required.**
* Experience in video production, livestreaming, and skilled in writing promotional content.

* Empathetic and able to build strong relationships with external partners, couriers and internal teams.
* High adaptability to change with the ability to execute quickly, seamlessly shifting form long-term strategy to immediate action tactical response.
* Thrives under pressure and in an evolving environment, taking ownership of problems rather than focusing on assigning blame.
* Curious and eager to learn all aspects of the business, with the ability to quickly develop skills and knowledge to become a recognized subject matter expert amongst peers.

**Our advantages:**

* Access to client and investor resources.
* Raised $35mil USD over a few years, driving significant company growth.

* Operate with a startup mentality, providing a comprehensive understanding of how a company functions.
* Opportunity to make a meaningful influence.
* Flat organizational structure with no hierarchy, seeking committed individuals who strive for excellence. If you are that individual, there is ample room to make a significant impact.

title: Program Director
company: South Bronx Overall Economic Development Corporation (SoBRO)
description:
**Job Description** 

**JOB TITLE:** PROGRAM DIRECTOR (SITE COORDINATOR)  
**REPORTS TO:** Program Supervisor (Senior Director of School-Age Programs)  
**DEPARTMENT:** School-Based Programs  
**POSITION:** FULL TIME/EXEMPT  
**SALARY**: $47,000- $50,000 per annum

SoBro's Center for Education and Career Development is dedicated to delivering dynamic and innovative programs for both youth and adults. Our mission is to engage individuals and families in career exploration, educational and employment opportunities, and leadership development, to foster economic independence. We are committed to enhancing the quality of life in the South Bronx through outcome-driven activities.

We are currently seeking an experienced and dedicated Program Director. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing and managing programs, assessing students' needs and interests, supervising staff, overseeing operations, and cultivating community relationships. This role requires a commitment to supporting successful enrollment and achievement of educational and departmental objectives.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

•Oversee the program's design and implementation.

•Manage the recruitment and retention of program participants.

•Recruit, hire, train and evaluate all staff members.

•Ensure staff have the necessary tools and equipment and monitor the environment for health and safetyhazards.

•Manage budget and contracts in compliance with funder requirements, DOE, DOH, and applicable labor laws.

•Conduct performance evaluations and develop professional development plans to maintain a high quality.

•Create and distribute schedules for staff members, and of all activities.

•Ensure accurate record keeping and reporting of all staff and participant attendance.

•Prepare and distribute written materials, including flyers, brochures, newsletters, and posting for allapplicable bulletin boards and platforms.

•Organize special events and culminating activities, such as showcases and culturally enriching field trips.

•Develop and promote opportunities for meaningful parent and community engagement.

•Serve as the primary liaison to the school principal and administration, collaborating on hiring decisions, andprogram delivery.

•Serve as the primary liaison with key partners, including the school principal and administration, tenantand/or resident association, property management, and advisory board. Collaborate on hiring decisions andoversee program delivery.

•Develop monthly reports, measure, and collect data, and maintain date archives.

•Attend relevant meetings including TA, SLT, PTA, Safety, Funders, Providers, SoBro, etc.

•Establish partnerships with community organizations to enhance programming.

•Assist with fundraising efforts as required.

•Perform other duties as assigned.

**Community Relations**

•Identify and assist with the development of community resources/service providers that meet andaddress the needs of participants, families, and the community.

**Knowledge and Skills**

•Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

•Proficiency in creating, modifying, and managing budgets.

•Strategic thinker with a solution-oriented approach.

•Proven ability to plan, organize, lead, and guide complex projects.

•Capable of working effectively as a team member with minimal supervision.

•Proficient in engaging with youth, families, and community members using a strength-based service model.

•Demonstrated initiative and organizational skills for managing multiple tasks simultaneously.

•High level of organizational aptitude and excellent time management skills.

•Knowledge in performance management database systems.

•Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Excel, along with other relevant software applications.

•Experienced in conducting program evaluations.

•Dependable, adaptable, honest, and trustworthy.

•Committed to employing culturally competent and culturally responsive practices.

**COVID-19 On-Site Safety Regulations:**

•All staff must adhere to the safety protocols established by SoBro, as well as guidelines from the Centers forDisease Control and Prevention (CDC), Department of Youth and Community Development (DYCD),Department of Health & Mental Hygiene (DOHMH), Office of Children and Family Services (OCFS), and theDepartment of Education/New York City Public Schools (DOE/NYCPS).

**Job Qualifications and other Requirements:**

•Bachelor’s degree in early childhood education preferred. Degrees in Child Development, ElementaryEducation, Physical Education, Recreation, Social Work, Program Administration, Psychology, or Sociologyare also acceptable.

•Minimum of three years of direct experience working with children under the age of 13, including at leasttwo years in a supervisory role.

•Demonstrated competency in Youth Development principles, College, and Career Exploration, and social- emotional learning activities.

•Knowledge of DOHMH & OCFS Part 414 regulations, DOE/NYCPS’s Chancellor’s Regulations, and CommonCore Standards.

•State Central Registry (SCR) and Criminal Background clearance required prior to employment, with ongoingmaintenance of clearance throughout employment.

•Medical Clearance must be obtained within two weeks of employment.

•Bilingual preferred.

**Hours**

•40 hours required weekly; including weekends, and evenings. Hours are subject to change based on theneeds of SoBro.

Interested parties must apply within the hosting jobsite (preferred)

description:
Actual Solutions Tutoring has an immediate need for a RELIABLE tutor who is open to working with an adult learner with disabilities. This would be for in-person sessions in the client's family home in Rutherford.  
The client is looking for help with basic addition/ subtraction, how to make change w/ $, reading comprehension such as sounding out words. She is on a grade 1 or 2 level with her skills.

The student is available any time on Tuesdays after 12PM for a 2 hour block of time. There is also opportunity for an additional 2 hours on a Saturday.

* Be hardworking.

* Receive weekly updates on new openings.
* Flexible schedule. You determine your schedule.

**About Actual Solutions Tutoring**

Our broad and deep talent/resource pool enables us to provide clients with a rich range of high-quality tutoring and personal coaching at very reasonable rates.

We understand that as students progress through life, their development involves more than academics. They develop dispositions that endure over time and significantly affect how they define, approach, and carry out their roles in their personal, career, and community lives. With so much at stake, it is important to provide students with the supports they need to experience success. Achieving success engenders a sense of self-efficacy - a "can do" attitude - and strengthens the ties between students and the world around them. In appreciation of this conceptual backdrop, Actual Solutions has committed itself to identifying, seizing, and maximizing opportunities to support families, schools, and student success.

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
**Job Title:** Administrative Coordinator

**Grade:** 16

**Salary:** $59,228 - $64,888


The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene is seeking a full-time Administrative Coordinator for the Crisis Systems Training Initiative. The Administrative Coordinator provides coordination of the Initiative's training, implementation activities, and oversight/evaluation of activities. The Crisis Systems Training Initiative is located at the Center for Practice Innovations (CPI), New York State Psychiatric Institute (NYSPI) and partners with the New York State Office of Mental Health (NYSOMH).


The Administrative Coordinator reports directly to the Director of the Crisis Systems Training Initiative. They will also work closely with CPI's Director of the Online Assistance Unit (OAU) on matters related to the Initiative's website pages and the CPI learning management system. Additionally, they will work with CPI's Associate Director who oversees CPI's data and module development units. Overall, the Administrative Coordinator supports the overall operations of the Initiative to run smoothly and serves as a first point of contact for users of Initiative training and learning management systems, and partnering with the Operations Manager to ensure everything is on schedule to meet or exceed deadlines.


This position requires a highly organized individual with excellent data, administrative and communication skills, who can work effectively with a diverse group of collaborators across state and city government, behavioral health providers, internal CPI/NYSPI departments, units, initiatives, and external vendors.


This position is fully remotely. All applicants must live in the New York City region to be considered.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


Duties and Responsibilities include:

* Working closely with Director in developing the Crisis Systems Training Initiative platform.
* Coordinate times for workgroups and steering committees with NYSOMH, CPI, NYCDOHMH, and other collaborators.
* Schedule meetings with the Initiative's internal and external partners.
* Coordinate all training activities with Initiative's implementation specialists and facilitate communication and any scheduling with the Online Assistance Unit (OAU) and the Operations Manager. Work alongside the Operations Manager with OAU on Learning Management System (LMS) Virtual Platform and any public facing content management systems, e.g website.
* Work alongside the Operations Manager with CPI's module development unit, subject matter experts, OMH, vendors, and others insure that new online training modules are developed and made available to learners.
* Schedule interactive learning community meetings, webinars, training sessions, consultations, and support calls. Support the development of pre and post evaluations, surveys, and questionnaires for ongoing data collection.
* Plan and set virtual meetings.
* Plan and set up F2F meeting/conference spaces.
* Support Director and Operations Manager in reviewing CPI's currently existing online training modules and recommend what is relevant for this Initiative.
* Participate on the design and creation of marketing materials for Initiative learning community meetings, webinars, training sessions, consultations, and support calls.
* Establish system of CEU's and prepare continuing education unit approval request paperwork.
* Maintaining Crisis Systems Training Initiative provider and contact lists.
* Enroll learners into CPI's learning management system, in collaboration with OAU, so that they can access online training modules and other resources.
* Co-writing/editing/proofreading newsletters and news briefs
* Develop, update, and proofread web pages .
* Compile and analyze data and creating reports (such as pilot reports, annual reports.)
* Arrange travel for all Initiative members.
* Monitor inventory and order office supplies.
* Process and track all accounts payable, including vendors, consultants, invited guests, and training groups.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* High school diploma and 5 years of related experience,
* Or an associate degree and 3 years of related experience,
* Or bachelor's degree in related field and 2 years of related experience.
	+ Personal lived & living experience of mental health and/or substance recovery can substitute for education.
* A minimum of 1 year of experience in Microsoft Office Software (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), design software such as Canva Pro, Adobe Creative Suite, and Adobe Acrobat Pro.
* 1 year of experience with streaming platforms (e.g., ZOOM).
* 1 year of experience with project administrative coordination

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 1 year experience in Project Planning or Management or related education/certificates
* 1 year in data collection and visualization software (e.g., Redcap, Qualtrics, and Tableau)
* 6 months experience with Continuous Quality Improvement
* 1 year experience in academic/research administration

**Work Location:** 1051 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10032

**To Apply:** Submit an application through our website at https://nyspi.applicantpro.com/jobs/. Please note only applications submitted through our website will be considered.


The Mission of the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is to promote the mental health of all New Yorkers, with a focus on providing hope and supporting recovery for adults with serious mental illness and children with serious emotional disturbances. Applicants with lived mental health experience are encouraged to apply. RFMH is deeply committed to supporting underserved individuals, organizations, and communities. To this end, RFMH is focused on implementing activities and initiatives to reduce disparities in access, quality, and treatment outcomes for underserved populations. A critical component of these efforts is ensuring that RFMH is a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees' unique attributes and skills are valued and utilized to support the mission of the Agency. RFMH is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.


The Research Foundation is a private not-for-profit corporation and is not an agency or instrumentality of the State of New York. Employees of the Research Foundation are not state employees, do not participate in any state retirement system, and do not receive state fringe benefits. Excellent Benefits Package. Employer/Minority/Women/Disabled/Veteran Employer. VEVRAA 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) compliant.

title: Implementation Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** Implementation Specialist

**Grade:** 25

**Salary:** $92,055 - $98,119


The Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene is seeking qualified candidates to fill **2** full-time Implementation Specialists/Trainers for CPI's new Crisis Systems Training Initiative. The Crisis Systems Training Initiative will provide training, support, education, and consultation to a diverse spectrum of crisis services across New York State. The Crisis Systems Training Initiative is looking for professionals to disseminate, implement, and sustain core competencies and best practices for crisis services providers. The Crisis Systems Training Initiative is located at the Center for Practice Innovations (CPI), in the New York State Psychiatric Institute.


Under the auspices of the New York State Office of Mental Health (OMH), the Center for Practice Innovations (CPI) promotes the widespread use of evidence-based practices within behavioral health provider agencies throughout New York State. Considered an "Intermediary Organization" for implementation, CPI uses innovative approaches to build stakeholder collaborations, develop and maintain practitioners' expertise, and build agency infrastructures that support implementing and sustaining evidence-based practices. CPI also works with OMH to identify and involve program participants, families, providers, and scientific/academic organizations as partners in supporting the goals of OMH and CPI.


Interested applicants for these positions must be self-directed, team players committed to person-centered, trauma informed, and culturally responsive crisis services. They must value a data-driven approach to planning, delivering, and improving behavioral health related crisis services. This includes openness to learning about reflective practice, healing justice, and harm reduction approaches to providing behavioral health crisis services and developing a thorough understanding of equity driven crisis services and practices. The applicants must have experience with behavioral health issues and structures through work and/or personal experience. Further, we seek people with excellent interpersonal skills who can work with diverse populations at all levels of an organization. Familiarity with other community services and systems, services for the unhoused, harm reduction, peer support, and carceral systems is preferred.


The Implementation Specialists/Trainers report directly to the Director of the Crisis Systems Training Initiative. The successful candidates will also work closely with the NYS OMH. Additionally, the successful candidates will work with staff in different units (e.g., data analysis, online assistance unit, content/module development unit, continuing education unit) to support the work. This position will require occasional travel throughout NYC/NYS. Finally, as members of CPI, the implementation specialists/trainers will collaborate closely with other initiatives in the center to support the work.


This position is fully remotely. All applicants must live in the New York City region to be considered.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


Duties and Responsibilities include:

* Leading or co-leading specific training efforts to support core competencies and best practices in the field of behavioral health related crisis services.
* Leading or co-leading specific technical assistance efforts (e.g., learning communities, quality improvement projects, etc.) to support implementation of core competencies and best practices in the field of behavioral health related crisis services.
* Developing culturally congruent and equity driven training materials including online modules, webinars, and in-person training.
* Developing culturally congruent and equity driven implementation tools for behavioral health related crisis service providers, agencies, program leaders, supervisors, practitioners, and service users and their communities, including implementation guides and practice-specific workbooks.
* Supporting the director in conducting, gathering, and interpreting data from ongoing needs assessments.
* Staying abreast of Federal, State, and Local policies and programs for behavioral health related crisis services and systems.
* Staying abreast of the evidence-base around evidence-based practices, best practices, and emerging issues.
* Traveling throughout New York City and other regions of NY to provide in-person training and implementation support.
* Working with CPI's module development unit, subject matter experts, OMH, vendors, and others to insure that new online training modules are developed and made available to learners.
* Supporting the development of pre and post evaluations, surveys, and questionnaires for ongoing data collection and quality improvement.
* Supporting director in reviewing CPI's currently existing online training modules and recommending what is relevant for this Initiative.
* Participating in the design and creation of marketing materials for Initiative learning community meetings, webinars, training sessions, consultations, and support calls.
* Writing/editing newsletters, news briefs, and project summaries.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* A bachelor's degree and 6 (six) years of experience in behavioral health related crisis services or a related field;
* Or a master's degree and 4 (four) years of related experience;
* Or a Doctorate degree and 2 (two) years of related experience.
	+ Personal lived & living experience of mental health and/or substance recovery can substitute for education.
* At least 5 (five) years of experience creating training content, facilitating training/workshops, and providing technical assistance or consultation services in behavioral health.
* A valid NYS driver's license. This role requires travel to in-state and to on-site meetings as needed.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* At least 2 years of experience supporting dissemination and implementation in diverse communities.
* Mental health and/or substance use recovery lived or living experience.
* At least 2 years of experience with supervision providing coaching and feedback to help staff, coworkers, or interns develop skills.
* At least 2 years of experience with the New York State behavioral healthcare system or similar experience with a different large behavioral healthcare system.
* At least 2 years of experience using software and web-based applications, such as learning management systems, as well as Zoom, Word, Excel, SharePoint, Outlook, and PowerPoint.

**Work Location:** 1051 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10032

**To Apply:** Submit an application through our website at https://nyspi.applicantpro.com/jobs/. Please note only applications submitted through our website will be considered.


The Mission of the Research Foundation for Mental Hygiene, Inc. (RFMH) is to promote the mental health of all New Yorkers, with a focus on providing hope and supporting recovery for adults with serious mental illness and children with serious emotional disturbances. Applicants with lived mental health experience are encouraged to apply. RFMH is deeply committed to supporting underserved individuals, organizations, and communities. To this end, RFMH is focused on implementing activities and initiatives to reduce disparities in access, quality, and treatment outcomes for underserved populations. A critical component of these efforts is ensuring that RFMH is a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees' unique attributes and skills are valued and utilized to support the mission of the Agency. RFMH is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

title: Director, BEACoN NJ Program
description:
**Position Reports to:**Vice President, Financing


**Location:** Remote position based in New Jersey


**Department****:** Financing

  



For over 40 years, Nonprofit Finance Fund has provided these nonprofits and their leaders with capital, consulting, and thought leadership. As a community development finance institution (CDFI), we work with nonprofits, partners, and systems to build racial equity and community wealth and well-being. Our vision is a world of equitable prosperity, where communities of color and other systematically excluded communities have the capital, community assets, knowledge, and agency to thrive. You can learn more about our work to achieve that vision by reading our Strategic Plan for 2024-2026 and our commitment to racial equity.



None of this work would be possible without the incredible people who work here. Our team consists of a diverse group of passionate professionals who care deeply about racial equity and community wealth and well-being. You can read more about what it's like to work here – and read a few examples of "a day in the life" for NFF staff" – on the careers page of our website.



Thank you for your interest in NFF. We hope you'll join us.

  


**About the Opportunity:**



The Director will have primary responsibility for overseeing Nonprofit Finance Fund's (NFF) BEACoN NJ Program, which currently aims to raise and deploy $20MM in flexible loan capital, and additional grant funding, to support a portfolio of debt investments that support nonprofits in New Jersey to acquire, develop/rehab, and operate assets that contribute to community wealth and well-being, as envisioned by NFF's larger Building Equitable Assets for Community Nonprofits (BEACoN) strategy. This will include affordable housing and nonprofit community service organizations. Loan products are expected to include acquisition/predevelopment loans with some combination of below market interest rates and credit-enhanced loans with flexible terms that leverage grant funding and concessionary capital sources. The fund is expected to be capitalized for 10 years.



The Director will have day to day responsibility for all aspects of Program management, including but not limited to: marketing, outreach, pipeline development and origination of new loans; ongoing monitoring and portfolio management of the loans; and coordinating the provision of technical assistance to program participants. Given the breadth of this scope and the early stage of this fund and program, the Director will prioritize three key responsibilities in the first 12 months: 1) deployment of capital to meet initial demand in the market and investor requirements, 2) capture ongoing market need and opportunity for continued deployment and 3) collect feedback and impact data for both internal and external purposes.



This position can be based remotely in New Jersey, and/or work from NFF's New York City office. There is a potential for up to 25-50% travel, primarily within New Jersey but occasionally out of state to attend conferences and funder/partner meetings.

  


**What** **you'll** **do****:**


***Deployment***


* Develop marketing materials, conduct outreach, and leverage existing and new relationships to generate interest and applications for financing from the Program
* Assess loan requests for mission/program alignment, impact, and credit quality
* Manage and prioritize new pipeline according to market need, borrower timelines, and availability of products, among other factors
* With support from VP, Financing and Chief Credit Officer, propose appropriate loan structures that balance flexibility, risk mitigation, and Program guidelines
* Issue term sheets that reflect NFF's indicative loan terms, covenants, due diligence requirements, and closing/disbursement conditions, tailored for each project as needed
* Identify and confirm the status of supplemental subsidies, tax credits, and other local and state funds needed to complete the project capital stack, as appropriate.
* Conduct borrower due diligence, credit review, project underwriting, and repayment analysis; prepare credit memos and present recommendations to NFF's credit committee(s) for formal approval
* Coordinate with NFF's legal and closing staff to ensure loans are documented and disbursed according to credit approved terms; resolve any pre-closing business or credit questions that arise


***Portfolio Management/Loan Monitoring***


* Monitor each loan from closing through payoff
* Collect and review quarterly and annual reporting from borrowers to ensure compliance with covenants and identify early signs of credit deterioration or project challenges
* Work directly with borrowers to help resolve challenges, providing assistance where appropriate and coordinating with other staff (legal, loan servicing, construction, credit, etc.) to support borrowers through life cycle of the loan


***Program Management***


* Accountability for setting, tracking, and meeting overall Program goals
* Serve as both the internal and external point of contact and face of the Program
* Collect borrower and portfolio level data, narratives, Program impact data, etc., to support periodic reporting to investors and funders
* Provide NFF leadership with feedback on successes and challenges in the Program
* Collaborate across NFF departments to share outcomes of the Program that can be used for developing related technical assistance, advocacy, additional capital/fundraising, attracting new partners and clients, and highlighting lessons learned from the Program that may be applied in other communities
* Identify external partners who can help NFF advance this work by connecting us with new clients, community leaders, referral sources, investors, funders, government agencies, etc.
* Attend community events and in-person meetings with community organizations to ensure NFF has a deep understanding and connection to community ownership opportunities and trends in NJ


**Who you are:**


* You have a minimum of 7-9 years of relevant and/or transferable experience in key areas including but not limited to: commercial and project-based lending, credit analysis, business development, and program management.
* You have relationships and are familiar with the ecosystem of community-based nonprofits in New Jersey, particular those providing social services and affordable housing.
* You have the ability to effectively use a variety of problem-solving/analytical approaches to address challenges
* You are able to coordinate complex activities and prioritize conflicting demands and deadlines
* You have excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* You have a strong relationship-building approach and understand the importance of collaboration across teams to move the work forward
* You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills
* You are committed to continuous improvement and demonstrate a growth mindset
* You are proficient with Microsoft Office applications and loan management systems
* You embody NFF's mission, core values and commitment to equity

  


**Compensation:**



At NFF, we are invested in discussing the depth and breadth of each candidate's background and experience during the interview process and using that information to determine the best offer while considering internal pay equity. NFF also takes into consideration internal equity in setting salary bands for each role. NFF provides an attractive benefits package that currently includes up to 18 paid holidays, 3 floating holidays, unlimited vacation time off, health insurance with NFF funded health reimbursement account on medical plan, and employer contributions toward retirement plan. In addition, NFF provides flexibility to work remotely and access to a "work from home" fund, and flexible spending accounts including medical, commuter, and childcare benefits.

title: After School Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
description:
**Company Description**

Achievement Behavior Care Services is an applied behavior analytics (ABA) service agency that works to provide home-based behavioral support services for students and families across Nassau and Suffolk Counties. Hour administrative headquarters is in Malverne, NY and we are dedicated to connecting compassionate ABA Service providers to children and families with needs for Special Education Services. Our Behavior Technicians (BTs) are a part of a network of caring ABA professionals who are invested in helping each other towards being successful in this mission. All of our services are lead with the guidance of one of our many esteemed Board Certified Behavioral Analysts (BCBAs).

**Flexible Schedule:**

Weekdays - AFTER SCHOOL HOURS & occasional Weekend Availability

Potential opportunities to build a small case load.

**Potential Long Island/Long Island Adjacent Locations :**

Rockville Centere, Hempstead, East Meadow, Bethpage, Wantagh, Far Rockaway/Eastern Queens, New Hyde Park, Woodbury, Hampton Bays, Shirley.

**\\*\\*ABA EXPERIENCE IS REQURIED\\*\\***

**\\*\\*RBT CERTIFICATION IS REQUIRED FOR SOME CASES, BUT NOT ALL\\*\\*** 40 hrTraining and supervision available.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Provide in-home, and community-based Applied Behavioral Analysis Therapy
* Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions
* Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work

**What we offer:**

* Professional development and ongoing supervision in the emerging field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) working with individuals on the autistic spectrum.

* A flexible, part-time schedule, many times near your home
* A rewarding experience helping children and families reach their full potential

**Expectations:**

* Study patient behavior and apply ABA principles
* Respond appropriately to different situations common among Autism patients and others with behavioral and developmental challenges
* Utilize key communication skills to provide effective feedback to patients
* Effectively communicate positive feedback to patients
* Be able to recognize and respond to critical improvements in patient behaviors.
* Become familiar with and use behavioral redirection techniques
* Know how to respond to negative behaviors appropriately
* Provide written documentation on each patient.

**Qualifications:**

* RBT Certification is a PLUS
* High School diploma required for entry-level positions
* Strong communication skills required.
* Ability to work under high-stress situations.
* Exhibits significant reliable habits, including timeliness and organizational skills.
* Proven experience working with pre-school and elementary school-aged children.
* Additional evidence of successful work with patients suffering from Autism and development issues.
* Other experience, certificates, or qualifications as required by state.
* Multilingual is a PLUS

title: Youth Program Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:

The Youth Program Coordinator (YPC) for HPC’s YouthConnect (YC) Program engages LGBTQ+ youth (ages 13-24) through community programming and outreach to create safe spaces where they can socialize and develop life skills. The YPC needs a deep understanding of LGBTQ+ youth issues, HIV/STI and substance abuse prevention, social services, and group facilitation. The YPC will work across multiple areas within HPC, including:

1. Connecting at-risk LGBTQ+ youth to HIV testing and either the HIV prevention (PrEP) program or the MAI program based on results.

2. Planning and facilitating a weekly empowerment group with workshops focused on LGBTQ+ support, education, socialization, and life skills to enhance safety, well-being, and mental health and reduce substance use and HIV/STI transmission.

3. Coordinating LGBTQ+ affirming social support events.

4. Providing or linking LGBTQ+ youth to academic tutoring or career development services.

5. Advocating for and supporting the establishment of LGBTQ+ affirming services and groups in Hudson County schools, colleges, and youth organizations.

6. Collaborating with New Jersey Statewide Student Support Services (NJ4S) to support LGBTQ+ youth mental wellness and prevention initiatives.

The YPC is responsible for tracking and managing client data, reporting to grant funders, developing new YC initiatives, and assisting with grant writing or community training on LGBTQ+ youth issues as needed. The YPC may also supervise YC interns and/or support staff.

Responsibilities:

● Collaborate with the Director of Youth Services (DYS) to create outreach schedules, strategies, and initiatives targeting areas frequented by LGBTQ+ youth.

● Conduct in-person and social media outreach, maintaining accurate logs, data, and client records.

● Conduct client intakes and assessments to identify and address the needs of youth through referrals or linkages to services at HPC or in the community.

● Provide 1:1 mentoring and social support to at-risk YC members as needed.

● Follow up with clients via phone, email, and social media, maintaining case notes on their progress.

● Accurately collect and maintain client case files, working with DYS to develop YouthConnect reports.

● Develop and facilitate weekly YouthConnect group topics and curriculum.

● Engage community stakeholders to contribute skills to YC members during groups or events.

● Conduct outreach and education on HIV testing and PrEP programs.

● Collaborate with schools and youth organizations to improve LGBTQ+ youth access to academic, health, and social services.

● Deliver LGBTQ+ youth-focused sensitivity training to community members and organizations.

● Participate in community task forces or groups focused on youth, ensuring LGBTQ+ needs are addressed.

● Attend all HPC staff, outreach, and planning meetings, and development opportunities.

● Maintain confidentiality while building healthy relationships with youth.

● Supervise YC interns and/or support staff as assigned.

● Perform other duties as assigned by the Director of Youth Services, Client Engagement Manager, Clinical Director, and/or Executive Director.

Qualifications/Requirements:

● Minimum of one year of experience working with youth aged 13-24.

● Minimum of an Associate’s Degree in social services or a related field; BA preferred.

● Extensive knowledge of LGBTQ+ youth issues, including STIs, HIV/AIDS, substance abuse, and homelessness.

● Moderate understanding of PrEP.

● Willingness to travel for PrEP and HIV/AIDS training.

● Familiarity with Hudson County services and venues frequented by target communities.

● Creative with workshop/group facilitation experience.

● Experience with community event outreach and social media

● Experience developing programs and creating safe spaces for LGBTQ+ youth.

● Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate professionally with clients.

● Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple projects.

● Self-motivated with the ability to engage and motivate individuals in target audiences.

● Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Drive, databases, spreadsheets, and social media platforms.

● Strong written and verbal skills in English; Spanish fluency preferred.

● Passion for working with marginalized communities, especially the LGBTQ+ community.

● Must be a team player.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.02 - $22.05 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

* Weekends as needed

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

License/Certification:
