title: Assistant Farm Manager - Full-time
description:
Assistant Farm Manager (Full-Time)

Reporting to the Manager of Heckscher Farm, the Assistant Farm Manager position is a full-time, non-exempt position working primarily Tuesday -Saturday, 9 am-5pm with winter hours (November to March) of 8-4pm (35 hours), although some early/evening hours and weekend days per month (outside of regularly scheduled special events) will be required. This position will be responsible for overall day-to-day management of Heckscher Farm in the absence of the Farm Manager. The Assistant Farm Manager will also help with daily animal care on the farm, will supervise volunteers, interns, full-time and part-time staff and will serve as on-site manager when the Manager is not present. This position will help staff our major festivals and may help with the teaching of farm-based school programs.

Specifically, the Assistant Farm Manager (Full-Time) will:

* Assist Manager in the daily coordination of Heckscher Farm operations.
* Train and manage interns and volunteers in proper animal husbandry and schedule accordingly
* Work with Manager to ensure all animal care policies are being followed and support staff in day-to-day needs
* Work with Farm Manager to ensure the health and well-being of all animals
* Keep records for veterinary visits, animal intakes and permits, as needed to USDA standards
* Assistant in managing volunteer hours and recruitment.
* Interact with the public within scheduled programs and non-scheduled “teaching moments”
* Manage farm staff, interns, and volunteers on scheduled farm shifts in absence of Farm Manager; serve as department lead in absence of Farm Manager.
* Handle any staffing, safety, or other issues that arise in absence of Farm Manager
* Assist with daily care and feeding of all farm livestock and otters
* Teach occasional educational programs such as farm tours, live animal programs, or Junior Curator class
* Staff and support SM&NC special event weekends, such as Harvest Festival and Spring on the Farm
* Additional duties as assigned

 Benefits package included

Qualifications & Essential Skills:

* Minimum of two years relevant, professional related experience in agriculture or Animal Care
* Preferred B.S/B.A. in agriculture, education, science or similar field
* Prior management or people leadership experience desired
* The position requires excellent communications skills, oral and written, and the ability to multitask and think creatively on program development and implementation.
* Able to lift 50 lbs., bend, stretch, stand for extended periods of time, climb stairs, twist, sit, walk, and/or run.
* Experience handling, caring for, and teaching with farm animals or a willingness to learn
* Excellent Internet and research skills. Must be well-organized and detail-diligent with ability to perform your own administrative work
* Must work 1 weekend day each week.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $24.00 per hour

Experience:

* Animal care: 1 year (Required)
* Management: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Infectious Disease NP / PA
description:
**Job Title:** Infectious Disease Nurse Practitioner (NP) / Physician Assistant (PA)


**Location:** Nanuet, NY


**Job Type:** Part-Time (1099 Contractor)


**Salary:** $80 - $90 per hour


**Schedule:** 1-2 days per week, 8-hour shifts


**About the Opportunity:** Our client, a well-regarded long-term care facility in Nanuet, NY, is seeking an Infectious Disease Nurse Practitioner (NP) to join their team. While an NP is preferred, Physician Assistants (PA) will be considered as a last resort or if they have their own collaborating physician. This role provides an excellent opportunity to specialize in infectious disease care with a flexible schedule.


**Position Overview:** We are looking for a skilled NP or PA with experience in infectious disease care. The ideal candidate will work 1-2 days per week, with shifts lasting approximately 8 hours. The position offers flexibility and a competitive hourly rate, and malpractice insurance is provided.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide specialized care for patients with infectious diseases.
* Perform patient assessments, develop care plans, and monitor treatment progress.
* Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to ensure comprehensive care.
* Educate patients and families on disease prevention, treatment, and health management.
* Maintain accurate medical records and documentation.

**Schedule:**

* Part-time, 1-2 days per week (8-hour shifts).

**Qualifications:**

* Nurse Practitioner (NP) with experience in infectious disease care preferred.
* Will consider Physician Assistants (PA) as a last resort or if they have their own collaborating physician.
* Valid NP or PA license in the state of New York.
* Strong clinical skills, with the ability to work independently.
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly rate of $80 - $90 per hour.
* 1099 contractor position.
* Malpractice insurance provided.

title: Wound Care Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Job Title:** Wound Care Registered Nurse (RN)


**Location:** Brooklyn, NY


**Job Type:** Full-Time


**Salary:** $115,000 - $120,000 per year


**Schedule:** 9 AM - 5 PM


**About the Facility:** Our client, a respected nursing home in Brooklyn, NY, is seeking an experienced Wound Care Registered Nurse (RN) to join their team. The facility is dedicated to providing exceptional patient care in a supportive and professional environment.


**Position Overview:** We are looking for a Wound Care RN to provide specialized care to residents with acute, chronic, or complex wounds. The ideal candidate will be responsible for wound assessments, care planning, and treatment while working closely with the healthcare team to ensure optimal outcomes. This is a full-time position with hours from 9 AM to 5 PM.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assess and manage the treatment of residents with various wound types.
* Develop and implement individualized care plans for wound management.
* Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other healthcare professionals to ensure coordinated care.
* Monitor and evaluate wound healing progress and adjust treatments as needed.
* Educate residents, staff, and families on wound care best practices and prevention strategies.
* Maintain thorough documentation of wound care treatments and patient outcomes.
* Stay current on the latest wound care techniques and protocols.

**Qualifications:**

* Current RN license in the state of New York.
* Proven experience as a Wound Care RN, preferably in a nursing home or long-term care setting.
* Certification in wound care (WOCN or equivalent) is preferred.
* Strong clinical and organizational skills.
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
* Compassionate, patient-centered approach to care.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary range of $115,000 - $120,000 per year.
* Comprehensive benefits package.
* Professional development opportunities in a supportive work environment.
* Opportunity to work in a respected nursing home with a collaborative healthcare team.

title: Head of Legal
description:
Captions is the AI-powered creative studio. Millions of creators around the world have used Captions to make their video content stand out from the pack and we're on a mission to empower the next billion.


Based in NYC, we are a team of ambitious, experienced, and devoted engineers, designers, and marketers. You'll be joining an early team where you'll have an outsized impact on both the product and company's culture.


We’re very fortunate to have some the best investors and entrepreneurs backing us, including Kleiner Perkins, Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, Uncommon Projects, Kevin Systrom, Mike Krieger, Antoine Martin, Julie Zhuo, Ben Rubin, Jaren Glover, SVAngel, 20VC, Ludlow Ventures, Chapter One, Lenny Rachitsky, and more.


Check out our latest milestone and our recent feature on the TODAY show and the New York Times.


***\\*\\* Please note that all of our roles will require you to be in-person at our NYC HQ (located in Union Square)*** **\\*\\***

We are looking for an experienced, strategic, and entrepreneurial legal professional to lead legal operations at Captions. As Head of Legal, you will serve as the primary legal advisor to the leadership team and the organization, and you will collaborate with Captions’ teams to identify ways to enhance and streamline our business, while mitigating legal and risk factors.

**Responsibilities**

* Lead and oversee all legal operations for Captions, ensuring alignment with business objectives and minimizing legal and regulatory risks
* Manage relationships with external law firms to ensure consistent communication and coordination among all legal partners
* Protect and manage the company's intellectual property (IP) portfolio, including trademarks, copyrights, and patents
* Oversee privacy and data protection initiatives, ensuring the company’s policies and practices comply with applicable laws and regulations, such as GDPR
* Monitor and ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, proactively addressing potential regulatory changes and their impact on the business.
* Draft, review, and negotiate contracts with customers, vendors, and other third parties to ensure legal compliance and protect the company's interests.
* Support the HR team in managing employment law matters, including employee contracts, immigration, and other related legal issues.
* Manage and maintain corporate legal documentation, including board resolutions, minutes, and other governance documents.
* Identify and mitigate potential legal risks across all areas of the business, developing strategies to address emerging risks as the company scales.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders (e.g., Finance, HR, CEO, COO) to align legal strategies with broader business goals.

**Preferred qualifications**

* Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school and active membership in good standing with at least one state bar, including NY
* 5+ years of legal experience, including experience at both a major law firm and an in-house role at a startup or high-growth technology company
* Preferred: Experience in AI, media, and/or consumer applications
* Demonstrated experience managing legal operations, including intellectual property (IP) management, privacy and data protection, regulatory compliance, employment law, and contract negotiation and management.
* Strong understanding of privacy laws and regulations, including but not limited to GDPR and SOC II
* Proven ability to navigate a complex regulatory landscape and provide strategic legal guidance in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Experience working with multiple stakeholders, including finance, HR, and executive leadership teams.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with a track record of building effective relationships with external law firms and internal teams.
* Ability to streamline legal processes to enhance operational efficiency and reduce legal costs.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and mitigating legal risks.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a rapidly scaling environment

### **Benefits:**

* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans
* 401K with employer match
* Anything you need to do your best work
* We’ve done team off-sites to places like Paris, London, Park City, Los Angeles, Upstate NY, and Nashville with more planned in the future


Captions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

*Please note benefits apply to full time employees only.*


Compensation Range: $200K - $260K

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP)
description:
**We provide help, create hope, and preserve dignity.**

As one of the largest human services agencies in New York, we offer a variety of programs and services addressing child welfare, family support, developmental disabilities, immigration, and mental health needs.

A Day in the Life of a DSP - video

https://youtu.be/cnK4z3KAqtE

Salary: $18

Job Title: Direct Support Professional DSP

Program: Developmental Disabilities

Location: Bronx, Queens, Staten Island

Shifts: All shifts available days, evenings, overnights, weekends, full time, per diem

www.catholicguardian.org

***Apply now to attend a virtual info session and then an in-person interview***

General Responsibilities:

Under the supervision of the residence manager and the clinical team, the Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for the direct care and personal development of each person assigned who lives in a Catholic Guardian Services (CGS) residence. Interactions and supports are to be carried out in a manner that creates a homelike atmosphere and fosters learning, dignity and respect.

Essential Job Functions

* Assists each person to overcome barriers and challenges to establish and maintain a network of community-based relationships and valued social roles
* Protects health, safety and well-being of each person served to the fullest extent possible, in accordance with the plan of care.
* Supports each person with dignity and respect and teaches skills in adaptive behavior, activities of daily living, development of self-help and social skills and which foster greater independence and self-direction.
* Carries out all interventions, procedures and notifications, including but not limited to medical, behavioral and nursing, in accordance with the service plan, agency requirements and OPWDD regulations
* Carries out meal purchasing, planning, preparation and implementation in accordance with each person’s dietary needs and doctor’s order’s.
* Performs housekeeping, cooking, laundry, light maintenance and light preventative maintenance duties as needed to maintain a clean, personalized, safe and homelike environment.

Requirements:

HS Diploma/GED, 1 year related personal care experience. Ability to cover shifts as needed

Preferred (but not required)

Drivers’ license (differential), RNA (differential), AMAP (differential), Shift Supervisor (differential)

What do you bring to the table:

You are empathetic, kind and a natural nurturer. You enjoy supporting adults achieve goals. You believe in our mission and are committed to being a part of our journey towards Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion for both staff and those who participate in our programs.

What do we bring to the table:

Union 888 Health Insurance, personal holidays, vacation, sick, personal days, 403b retirement plan, training/job development and growth opportunities, Tuition Reimbursement, Student Loan Repayment, Life Insurance, STD/LTD, AD&D Insurance, AFLAC, Pet Insurance, a robust Employee Assistance Program with over 8,000 free training classes and additional support, a commitment to Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion thru our JEDI Steering Committee, Credit Union, Tickets At Work, Flexible Spending Accounts – Health/Commuter/Dependent Care

Nassau County provides a high quality of life with its excellent schools, safe neighborhoods, recreational opportunities, and cultural richness. Its proximity to New York City, combined with its suburban charm, makes it an ideal place for families, professionals, and retirees seeking a balanced lifestyle.

**Residential Environment:**

* Nassau County comprises three towns including Hempstead, North Hempstead, and Oyster Bay as well as two cities, Glen Cove and Long Beach. Some of the most notable communities in Nassau County include Garden City, Great Neck, Rockville Centre, Manhasset, and Port Washington.
* The housing market in Nassau County is diverse, ranging from historic homes, bungalows, modern single-family homes, townhouses, and luxury apartments.
* Nassau County has a population of approximately 1.4 million residents. The county covers an area of about 453 square miles, including both land and water.

**Employment Opportunities**:

* Nassau County has a robust economy with key sectors including healthcare, education, retail, finance, and professional services. Major employers include Northwell Health, Nassau Health Care Corporation, and various school districts as well as many small local businesses.

**Transportation**:

* Major highways serving Nassau County include the Long Island Expressway (I-495), Northern State Parkway, and Southern State Parkway.
* The Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) provides extensive commuter rail service to New York City and other parts of Long Island. Nassau Inter-County Express (NICE) operates local bus services.

**Schools**:

* Nassau County is renowned for its excellent public-school systems, with many districts receiving high ratings for academic performance, extracurricular activities, and college readiness. There are also numerous prestigious private schools offering various educational philosophies and religious affiliations.
* The county is home to several higher education institutions, including Hofstra University, Adelphi University, Nassau Community College, and Molloy College

**Shopping and Dining**:

* Nassau County offers a variety of shopping options, from upscale malls like Roosevelt Field to downtown shopping districts in villages like Rockville Centre and Garden City.
* The dining scene in Nassau County is diverse, featuring various cuisines from all around the world. Residents can enjoy everything from fine dining and seafood to casual eateries and ethnic restaurants.

**Recreational Activities**:

* Nassau County boasts numerous parks, beaches, and recreational facilities. Notable parks include Eisenhower Park, Jones Beach State Park, and the Planting Fields Arboretum.
* The county is rich in cultural institutions, such as the Nassau County Museum of Art, the Cradle of Aviation Museum, and Old Bethpage Village Restoration

**Healthcare Facilities**:

* The county is served by several hospitals and healthcare facilities, including North Shore University Hospital, NYU Winthrop Hospital, and Mount Sinai South Nassau.

**Cultural and Entertainment Venues**:

* The Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum hosts concerts, sporting events, and other entertainment. The county also offers golf courses, theaters, and a variety of recreational activities.
* Popular community events throughout the year include Hempstead’s Memorial Day Parade and Great Neck Plaza’s Promenade Nights.

**Community Engagement**:

* Nassau County is a diverse and multicultural community with a wide range of ethnicities and cultures. This diversity is reflected in local festivals, cultural events, and parades.
* Local governments regularly hold town hall meetings, providing residents with opportunities to voice their concerns, ask questions, and engage with elected officials on issues affecting their communities.

**Safety and Security**:

* Nassau County is a safe place to live, with effective law enforcement, active community involvement, and comprehensive public safety services. The county’s focus on community policing, disaster preparedness, and public health initiatives contributes to a secure and healthy living environment for its residents.

Overall, Nassau County provides a high quality of life with its excellent schools, safe neighborhoods, recreational opportunities, and cultural richness making it an ideal place for families, professionals, and retirees seeking a balanced lifestyle.

title: Commercial Refrigeration Service Technician
description:
Service Plus is seeking an experienced Commercial Refrigeration Service Technician to service a growing customer base with commercial kitchen equipment both in and out of warranty. Our service territory covers most of New Jersey, Eastern Pennsylvania, and parts of New York. This is an excellent opportunity to join the leading Commercial Kitchen Equipment Repair Company in the state.

As a Commercial Refrigeration Service Technician, you will have the opportunity to repair and service Reach-Ins, Merchandisers, Display Cases, Ice Machines, and much more.

Our diverse customer base includes hospitals, restaurants, nursing homes, pizzerias, delis, banquet halls, corporate cafeterias, fire departments, and any other establishments with commercial kitchens.

**Our office is located in Flanders, NJ and candidates will be required to travel to our office for training. After the training period is over, a company vehicle will be provided.** 

**Responsibilities:**

* The ability to troubleshoot, repair, and perform preventative maintenance on Large/Small Commercial Refrigeration utilizing Electric 1-3Phase 120v-480v.
* Must be able to operate hand tools, power tools, all types of gauges, meters, etc.
* Ability to lift a minimum of 75+lbs regularly, at times exert up to 150lbs of force to pull, push, lift carry, etc.
* Ability to climb and work on a ladder, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, reach, stand, walk, twist, grasp to perform essential job functions.
* Ability to work in all commercial kitchen conditions, i/e: extreme heat/cold, noise, crowded spaces, etc.
* Must adhere to all safety first policies, able to operate a commercial vehicle with prudence
* Must be able to provide high-quality customer care and have the ability to effectively communicate with customers and other employees, work independently without close supervision
* Promoting additional products and services, such as preventative maintenance, kitchen/ housekeeping chemicals, water treatment products, etc.
* Maintaining truck stock inventory within the prescribed company guidelines and standards. Must also follow the truck maintenance schedule and keep company vehicle organized and clean.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver's license and acceptable driving record
* Must be at least 18 years of age
* 1-2 years minimum similar experience and/or training preferred, but not required
* Availability to work variable and flexible hours, including weekends, holidays, and on call in rotation with other team members, overtime pay available
* Ability to follow directions and specific process steps to ensure quality workmanship
* Strong plumbing, mechanical, and electrical knowledge are a plus
* EPA Certification 608, 40 CFR Part 82, Subpart F with minimum of:

- Type I for servicing small appliances.

- Type II for servicing or disposing of high- or very high-pressure appliances, except small appliances and MVACs

- Type III for servicing or disposing of low-pressure appliances.

- Universal for servicing all types of equipment.

**Benefits:** 

* Company service van
* Dispatched from home (leave your house in the morning with van, return at end of day with van)
* The latest industry training and certification opportunities
* Career opportunities providing growth and advancement
* Medical and dental plans available
* Company matching IRA
* Company uniforms
* Company iPhone
* Career opportunities providing growth and advancement, including the latest industry training and certification opportunities
* PTO

**Compensation**:

* Apprentice level technician starting at 45K yearly, and up to 100K yearly for high level technicians, all based upon experience.

title: On-Call Child Care Counselor
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Family Services of Westchester, Inc. (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children, and individuals at every stage of their lives. Serving 30,000 people a year, including 20,000 children, with nearly 50 innovative programs, including counseling, education, and support, FSW is a pillar of health in the Westchester community, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

FSW’s Community Residence for Children and Adolescents is an OMH-licensed eight-bed residential setting for adolescent boys who have been diagnosed with a Severe Emotional Disturbance (SED).

The Community Residence of provides families with education, information, skill development, and emotional support. Rehabilitation for children and adolescents at the Community Residence occurs in a therapeutic milieu that provides caring and respect, while fostering healing, growth and the development of skills.

Family Services of Westchester is seeking **Full-Time Child Care Counselors** to work at our Community Residence in New Rochelle, NY. The candidate will be responsible and able to professionally conduct themselves while representing Family Services of Westchester.

**Schedule:**  
*Sunday- Thursday 11pm to 7am*

**Responsibilities:**

* Direct Service position to monitor, train and support positive gains in child activities of daily living.
* Provide individualized care for each resident in a therapeutic milieu.
* Prompt positive social interactions based upon the individual treatment plan for each child and family.
* To keep a daily written report and log on the daily activities of the group.
* To counsel and/or assist child manage their behaviors and utilize the safety plan in order to prevent and/or decrease crisis situations.

**Requirements:**

* High School diploma
* Valid Driver's License
* Minimum 21 years old
* MUST BE AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position of Child Care Counselor speaks to your capabilities, experience, and commitment to social service, please complete the online application on Indeed.com, upload your resume. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*Family Services of Westchester is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Department: Experiential Production

Reports To: Program Director

About Us:

* VTI partners with leading experiential marketing agencies to provide top-tier production experiences that bring creative concepts to life. We specialize in creating immersive, engaging mobile marketing experiences through live events, activations, and mobile tours. We might be working with bands, fashion brands or media companies – creating cool mobile experiences to amplify their brands.
* As an end-to-end partner (we are both an agency and a custom fabricator) we ensure smooth execution and production readiness, from project specs to on-the-road deployments.
* We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Project Coordinator to assist the Program Director.
* In this role, you will help drive multiple internal projects to make them come to life, oversee communication between production teams and client facing teams, and ensure that all assets and production elements are road-ready in time to activate marketing campaigns for our clients.

Key Responsibilities:

* Support Pre-Activation Management: Assist in coordinating client requests and managing expectations to ensure all production needs are met.
* Project Specifications: Collaborate with the Account Director and Operations Director to translate client briefs into precise, actionable project specs, including timelines, budgets, and technical requirements.
* Internal Coordination: Act as a liaison between internal departments, ensuring the production, creative, and operations teams are aligned with client goals and project milestones.
* Project Documentation: Maintain detailed records of project specs, changes, and updates, ensuring all teams have the latest information.
* On-the-Road Readiness: Assist with ensuring all experiential assets and equipment are properly packed, labeled, and prepared for roadshow deployment.
* Issue Resolution: Address any logistical or production challenges that arise during the planning and pre-production phases, escalating issues to the Account and Operations Directors when necessary.
* Progress Reporting: Regularly update the Program Director and Operations Director on project progress, flagging any potential delays or issues.

Key Requirements:

* Experience: ideally 1-3 years in project management, account coordination, or production role, preferably within experiential marketing or event industries with strict deadlines.
* Detail-Oriented: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to track multiple moving parts across various projects.
* Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a focus on clear, concise internal documentation and client-facing professionalism.
* Collaboration: A team player who can work seamlessly across departments to ensure project success. You get things done an don't mind rolling your sleeves up!
* Problem-Solving: Ability to anticipate potential production challenges and proactively suggest solutions.
* Time Management: Strong ability to manage deadlines and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Technical Aptitude: Comfortable working with production specs and operational details related to production fabrication, live event and experiential activations.

What We Offer:

* Competitive salary
* Opportunities for professional growth within a collaborative and supportive work environment

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

* East Brunswick, NJ 08816 (Required)

title: Product Commercial Director
description:
**ABOUT FANDUEL**



FanDuel Group ("FanDuel") is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media.



FanDuel has a presence across all 50 states with approximately 17 million customers and 28 retail locations. FanDuel is based in New York with offices in New Jersey, Georgia, California, Oregon, Canada and Scotland.



Its networks FanDuel TV and FanDuel+ are broadly distributed on linear cable television and through its relationships with leading direct-to-consumer over-the-top platforms.



FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).


**THE ROSTER**



At FanDuel, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We're dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does "winning" look like at FanDuel? It's recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best work—and a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creatives professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of "We Are One Team" runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.


**THE POSITION**  

Our roster has an opening with your name on it



The Commercial Director will work closely with the Commercial Vice President to influence and drive the Sportsbook commercial strategy. This person will be responsible for proactively monitoring the business performance, spotting trends/criticalities and consistently raise the bar for customer and business outcomes. This role will predominantly focus on partnering with FanDuel's various product teams to inform our sportsbook strategy and investment to build the strongest product proposition possible.


**THE GAME PLAN**  

Everyone on our team has a part to play


* Be the commercial liaison with various Product teams to help inform ideation & prioritization.
* Help coordinate sportsbook post launch product/feature performance assessment and make recommendations regarding further investment decisions.
* Help lead a program of work and partner with stakeholders to remove customer pain points and improve core product experiences to facilitate frictionless end-to-end journeys.
* Identify opportunities to improve our conversion funnel and work cross-functionally to get these implemented
* Be the commercial lead on components of the live betting project to support the delivery of our strategy in 2024 and beyond.
* Help evaluate new/emerging product opportunities and influence investment decisions.
* Support multiple Product teams in setting an ambitious multi-year vision and strategy for our product capabilities and approach – one that is sufficiently compelling to grow our market share.
* Build and coach a high-performing team that adds value to the broader business, while being a key thought leader for other areas of the business.
* Be a leader of the Sportsbook business and steward of the P&L that constantly strives to improve our profitability.


**THE STATS**  

What we're looking for in our next teammate


* 7+ years of relevant work experience in an analytical/commercial/product/trading field is required
* Bachelor's Degree required
* 3+ years managing / people leadership experience is required, with a proven track record of also leading complex cross-functional projects
* Effective at relationship building and sensitive to stakeholders' needs
* Presents with impact and has exec presence
* Expert understanding of the betting/gaming category
* Strategic mindset: takes a long-term view and anticipates future trends and implications
* Commercial acumen: expert understanding of P&L, business principles and understands the levers
* Collaborates: is a team player - works with the team and stakeholders across the organization to get things done efficiently
* Advanced in PowerPoint, Excel and data visualization


**PLAYER BENEFITS**  

We treat our team right



From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give. Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:


* An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
* Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
* Career and professional development resources to help you refine your game plan for owning and driving your career and development
* Be well, save well and live well - with FanDuel Total Rewards your benefits are one highlight reel after another


FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principal states, "We Are One Team!" We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, Veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included. We want our team to include diverse individuals because diversity of thought, diversity of perspectives, and diversity of experiences leads to better performance. Having a diverse and inclusive workforce is a core value that we believe makes FanDuel stronger and more competitive as One Team!


***The applicable salary range for this position is $144,000 - $180,000, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.***

title: Manager, Programmatic Partnerships
description:
**About Fubo:**



With a mission to build the world's leading global live TV streaming platform with the greatest breadth of premium content and interactivity, FuboTV Inc. (NYSE: FUBO) aims to transcend the industry's current TV model. Fubo operates in the U.S., Canada, France and Spain. The company also has a growing technology center in Bangalore, India that is developing strategic product and technology features for the global Fubo platform.



We're rapidly growing in employees, subscribers, and content offerings! Which means we need your help taking us to the next level.



Fubo is committed to excellence through diversity, which involves attracting talented people from diverse backgrounds and traditions. We encourage everyone to apply.


**About the role:**


**\\*This role is a New York City based HYBRID position. Candidates must be located in NYC, and willing to come into the office on a hybrid basis, multiple times a week.\\***



This is a full-time position based in New York reporting directly to the Senior Director, Programmatic Sales Development. The **Manager, Programmatic Partnerships**will lead the overall revenue growth and development of existing programmatic clients within the U.S. and Canada, with a focus on PMPs and Open Marketplace advertisers.



Working in close collaboration with the sales team, you will succeed by developing and executing programmatic advertising strategies, identifying new business opportunities (A Domains/Open Market and PMP upsells), and nurturing a "top of mind" sensibility within existing client relationships.



The role will involve maintaining an excellent understanding of programmatic media that helps meet and exceed revenue growth targets.


**What you'll do:**


* Spearhead strategies and tactics against a defined list of PMP and Open Marketplace clients to ensure maximum and continuous investment against Fubo's portfolio of products; including first-party data management and activation
* Lead data-driven conversations and custom reporting to provide insights and tell client-relevant stories that provide a full picture of their advertising's impact on business results
* Post sales by the direct sales team, consult with clients on their campaign goals and strategies to ensure they are maximizing the value of Fubo's capabilities
* Collaborate with Account Management and Sales Account Executives to educate your clients on how to most effectively plan, execute, optimize and build on successful advertising campaigns across our sales offerings – focusing on the growth of your portfolio of business and ensuring programmatic buyers are up-to-date on our evolving suite of products and solutions
* Build and own key relationships with programmatic client planning, trading and analytical teams
* Collaborate with engineers, data scientists and product managers to solve complex technical problems including delivery and frequency analysis, consumer journey visualizations etc.
* Troubleshoot advanced technical problems including performance issues, measurement discrepancies and constrained targeting


**What you'll need to succeed:**


* 3+ years of consultative, client-facing work at an ad tech company (SSPs, DSPs a plus) in a demand facilitation role, advertising agency, digital marketing or other data-heavy industry
* Programmatic trading experience is a must
* Eager to constantly learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment that requires self-driven education and improvement
* Outstanding problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to distill complex, data-heavy information into simple but powerful stories and insights
* Strong interest in learning the underlying mechanics of Fubo's ad stack and the ability to act as a conduit between clients and product teams to consistently improve our offering over time
* Comfortable with cross-functional collaboration with a proven ability to navigate ambiguous and complex problems and situations
* Effective time management skills, especially the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
* Advanced MS Excel skills and the ability to efficiently wrangle extremely large data sets


**Perks & Benefits:**


* At Fubo, you will have the opportunity to personally influence what live media looks like after it goes through its next big transformation
* Fubo provides a highly competitive compensation based on experience and market standards
* Robust benefit package including Health/Dental/Vision coverage sponsored up to 100% for employees, 401k, Life Insurance, and commuter benefits
* Free Premium Fubo Account
* Unlimited PTO days and regular company-wide activities.
* Fubo's main Headquarters are located in Midtown Manhattan, with offices in Denver, Paris, and Bangalore
* Fubo is an e-verified company


Fubo's minimum base salary for this role if hired in New York City is $90,000 per year; maximum base salary for this role is $125,000 per year. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Fubo's commission plan, unlimited PTO, and a full range of medical benefits. Final offer amount will be at the company's sole discretion and determined by multiple factors, including years and depth of experience and expertise, location and other business considerations.

title: Pediatric Vaccines Health & Science Professional _ STATEN ISLAND, NY
description:
Why Patients Need You
Everything we do, every day, is in line with an unwavering commitment to the quality and the delivery of safe and effective products to patients. Our science and risk-based compliant quality culture is innovative and customer oriented. Whether you are involved in manufacturing, testing, or compliance, your contribution will directly impact patients.
What You Will Achieve
All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.  

The Vaccines Health and Science Professional (HSP) is responsible for the promotion of a Vaccines Portfolio across customers and channels. This position will require regular live in field customer engagement in addition to virtual engagements.  

The HSP is accountable for launching new products, deciding upon the best strategies to manage business relationships, understanding, and securing formulary access, and engaging in product promotion within the assigned geography. In addition, the HSP is charged with sales efforts and relationship development with customers and accounts, including Therapeutic Area Specialists, and Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs).  

The HSP should possess customer, market and business acumen combined with strong product and disease state knowledge; demonstrate strong sales, strategic business development, account management skills and in-depth customer engagement expertise in both virtual and in-person settings; utilize a systematic approach to virtual engagement (e.g., clear agenda, next steps/follow ups); have outstanding communications skills; be adept in the operation of digital and virtual tools/multi-platforms skills. Effective at working remotely in collaboration with cross-functional internal teams to address customer needs and compliantly deliver on Pfizer business objectives.  

How You Will Achieve It* Drive sales in assigned territory to maximize approved business objectives
* Engages with customers both face to face and virtually
* Develops and implements effective business and territory call plans; effectively identifies and implements live/virtual engagement strategies with customer to maximize overall effectiveness and impact
* Effectively builds rapport and relationships with customers in both live and virtual environments; uses judgment to maintain customer engagement by successfully utilizing existing and ever-changing digital tools effectively for successful customer engagement
* Understands and leverages internal reports and analytics to assist with identifying, developing, and implementing strategic business opportunities
* Compliantly leverages product and disease state knowledge using approved clinically oriented disease state information and patient resources, as applicable
* Demonstrates market knowledge, uncovering barriers and drivers across all relevant business channels (Public Health, Private Market, Retail, etc.)
* Collaborate effectively and compliantly with cross-functional colleagues, including Field Medical and Account Management, to address customer inquiries and advance Pfizer objectives
* Completes all administrative expectations on time and compliantly (e.g., entering customer calls appropriately, submitting expenses, responding to all requests from sales leadership, managers and/or Pfizer internal partners)

  

Qualifications
Must-Have  

  

* Bachelor’s Degree
* Minimum 2 years’ experience in one or more of the following:
* Professional Sales or Promotional Activity
* Small Business Owner or other Entrepreneurial experience, Marketing, Customer Service and/or Account Management
* Relevant Healthcare/Scientific roles (e.g., RN, Pharmacist, PT, OT, etc.)
* Educator (e.g., Teacher, Principal)
* Full time Military experience
* Must live within 25 miles of the border of the territory
* Valid US driver’s license and a driving record in compliance with company standards

Nice-To-Have* 1 year of pharmaceutical, biotech, medical sales and/or medical related marketing
* Strong track record of sales or marketing success, strong territory management skills, outstanding communications skills, as well as demonstrated teamwork, leadership ability and accountability
* Experience with Vaccines therapeutic area and products
* Knowledge of posted territory customers and markets (prescribers/HCPs/institutions/organizations)
* Reside within the territory boundaries

Other Job Details* Last day to apply: Sep 18th, 2024
* This is a 100% field-based role
* The annual base salary for this position ranges from $71,700 to $180,200 . In addition, this position offers an additional quarterly Sales Incentive bonus. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits| (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to any location outside of the United States.

Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.

title: User Experience Testing, Director
description:
The UX Testing Lead will play a crucial role in driving user-centricity within Biopharma's services, systems, and products. Their primary responsibility will be to develop and execute effective research and testing strategies aimed at enhancing customer experiences across various digital and non-digital interfaces. This will involve conducting user testing activities and analyzing the results to identify areas for improving user experiences. The insights gained will then be translated into actionable recommendations. The UX Testing Lead will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate research findings into the development process and create designs that prioritize user needs. Strong communication and collaboration skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously are essential for success in this role. Staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in UX research and testing is crucial.  

Key Responsibilities:* Design, build and lead a scalable, efficient, and decision-driven conversion testing and experiment capability that enables Pfizer to utilize data and make optimal decisions to provide patients, caregivers and doctors with exceptional interactions with our digital products and services.
* Develop and implement framework for conducting conversion testing and experiments, defining key metrics and success criteria, and establishing processes for data collection and analysis.
* Plan and conduct a variety of qualitative and quantitative research studies, including usability testing, surveys, interviews, A/B testing, heat map analysis, focus groups, and others to gather data on user behavior, preferences, pain points and to validate design hypotheses.
* Analyze qualitative and quantitative data and interpret research findings to provide actionable recommendations that can improve our product’s usability and functionality
* Synthesize the data, identify patterns and trends, and draw meaningful insights that can inform design decisions and improve the usability and functionality of our products.
* Leverage user personas, customer journey and touchpoint maps to provide insight into user-centered design decisions
* Create detailed reports and presentations to communicate research findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels
* Develop and implement comprehensive user experience (UX) research strategies that align with Pfizer’s business goals and product roadmaps
* Champion user-centered design principles that are inclusive and accessible and advocate for the user perspective throughout the product development lifecycle
* Stay updated and incorporate industry practices, emerging trends, and new technologies into our UX research practices to continuously improve our research practices
* Utilize and manage research tools and software to conduct and analyze studies effectively
* Manage research budgets, timelines, and external research vendors as needed
* Collaborate with our Digital site teams, brand teams, digital analytics, product teams, etc.
* Create detailed reports and presentations to effectively communicate research findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.

  

 BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* Bachelor's degree, plus 10+ years of experience
* Must be proficient in analyzing qualitative and quantitative data to derive meaningful insights about user behavior
* Familiarity with various UX research methods such as surveys, interviews, usability testing, A/B testing and observational studies is essential. Proficiency in software tools used for these methods is required
* Possess basic design skills to better collaborate with design teams and understand the design process
* Be empathetic to users' needs and experiences and curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the ‘what’
* Ability to clearly communicate research findings verbally, written and via data visualization to various stakeholders at all levels
* Ease in recognizing patterns and identifying problems, and to think critically about potential solutions
* Robust knowledge and expertise in information architecture, prototyping, and wireframing
* Prior experience working with standard research and design tools such as UserZoom and Figma (for example)
* Knowledge of user interface (UI) design principles
* Experience working in agile development environments
* Knowledge of UX design principles and practices
* Proficiency in statistical analysis and data visualization tools
* Certification in UX or related field
* Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.

  

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
N/A
NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
N/A  

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION* Last Date to Apply: September 18, 2024
* Work Location Assignment: 2.5 days a week in office New York Headquarters
* Eligible for employee referral bonus

  


The annual base salary for this position ranges from $161,600.00 to $269,400.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 20.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.

title: Grants Administrator
description:
**Title:** **Grants Administrator**
===================================

Title: Grants Administrator


Location: Upper East Side


Org Unit: Research Administration


Work Days: Monday-Friday


Weekly Hours: 35.00


Exemption Status: Exempt


Salary Range: $80,000.00 - $97,600.00


* As required under NYC Human Rights Law Int 1208-2018 - Salary range for this role when Hired for NYC Offices


**Position Summary**
--------------------



Under guidance, coordinates and assists with the overall financial, administrative and grant activities of the department.


**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


* Oversees and coordinates grants management and financial management in support of research staff in the department. Serves as the point-of-contact and resource to staff for all research grant activities for pre- and post-award.
* Oversees and coordinates post-award activities. Provides on-going financial oversight of grants and contracts including but not limited to: tracking of funds, evaluating expenditures, forecasting, preparation and submission of progress and final reports.
* Responsible for grants and contracts processing. Oversees accurate completion and timely routing of internal paperwork and disclosures. Negotiates with sponsor as needed for contract execution. Maintains database and records to track activities.
* Oversees and coordinates pre-award activities. Ensures timely submission of federal, foundation, and industry-sponsored grant applications and contracts. Oversees the organization and preparation of all components of grant applications.
* Maintains, tracks and updates effort tracking to ensure compliance with time and effort policies.
* Works with investigators to manage budgeting process for grants and contracts and assists in general budget development and implementation.
* Manages purchasing, payments of services and reimbursements of expenses. Monitors expenses for correct allocation to funds.
* Assists with the preparation of standard and ad-hoc financial reports as needed. Provides analysis and reasons for variance as needed. Forecasts expenditures and makes recommendation for corrective action if deficits are projected.
* Ensures compliance with institutional policies regarding systems access and training required for access for human subjects research.
* May assist with program specific promotional or outreach activities.
**Education**
-------------


* Bachelor's Degree in related field
**Experience**
--------------



Approximately 2 years of experience with non-profit financial activity.


Full knowledge of federal and non-federal research regulations and policies.


Experience in grants managment, including pre- and post-award management, financial analysis, budgeting and eperience with NIH and industry sponsors.


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
-----------------------------------


* Effective oral and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to pay close attention to detail.
* Ability to manage multiple large-scale projects and meet deadlines.
* Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office Suite and database applications.
**Licenses and Certifications**
-------------------------------


**Working Conditions/Physical Demands**
---------------------------------------

  


Weill Cornell Medicine is a comprehensive academic medical center that is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery, and the education of future physicians and scientists in New York City and around the world. Our doctors and scientists - faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and the Weill Cornell Physician Organization - are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Our medical practices serve communities throughout New York City, and our faculty provide comprehensive care at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Brooklyn Methodist Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Westchester Behavioral Health Center, and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. At Weill Cornell Medicine, we work together to treat each individual, not just their conditions or illnesses, as we strive to deliver the finest possible care for our patients - the center of everything we do. Weill Cornell Medicine is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Weill Cornell Medicine provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to protected status, including race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

  

  

**Nearest Major Market:** Manhattan
  

**Nearest Secondary Market:** New York City

title: Associate Scientist
description:
Why Patients Need You
Pfizer’s purpose is to deliver breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Research and Development is at the heart of fulfilling Pfizer’s purpose as we work to translate advanced science and technologies into the therapies and vaccines that matter most. Whether you are in the discovery sciences, ensuring drug safety and efficacy or supporting clinical trials, you will apply cutting edge design and process development capabilities to accelerate and bring the best in class medicines to patients around the world.
What You Will Achieve
This is a laboratory-based position within the Vaccine Research and Development – Analytical Development group where the individual will provide routine sample testing to support process development of early phase vaccine candidates. Assays include but are not limited to HPLC and UV-VIS.
How You Will Achieve It* Under supervision, perform routine sample testing in support of process development of early phase vaccine candidates. This includes preparing samples, setting up and running the instruments, and analyzing data.
* Document experiments and analyze data obtained from sample testing contemporaneously in notebook as directed.
* Plan daily workflow to complete the tasks/experiments outlined by the supervisor.
* Contribute and participate in general laboratory maintenance activities (such as maintenance of equipment, managing laboratory waste).


Qualifications
Must-Have* BS in Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry or related discipline with 0-2 years of related laboratory work experience
* Proficiency in the use of word processing, Excel, PowerPoint and relevant scientific software is desirable.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Motivated and detail-oriented


Nice-to-Have* Working knowledge of analytical techniques used for the characterization of pharmaceutical substances and products

NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS* 40 hours per week

title: Manager, Paid Search
description:
ROLE SUMMARY
As part of the Chief Marketing Organization the Manager Paid Search will be part of the Performance Marketing team. This individual will be responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive Paid Search strategy to enhance the visibility and overall performance for Pfizer websites. This role requires a strategic thinker, as well as hands-on experience. You will be part of our newly created In-House team, collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve business objectives. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of creating and managing successful paid search campaigns, and a deep understanding of industry trends.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES* Responsible for developing, implementing, and managing paid search campaigns across various platforms to drive key actions and achieve business objectives for a portfolio of brands.
* Identify, evaluate, and launch new opportunities and optimizations within the paid search landscape in alignment with Pfizer guidelines.
* Develop and execute paid search strategies, including keyword research, ad copywriting, bid management, and campaign optimization.
* Manage and allocate budgets effectively across various paid search channels based on campaign KPIs.
* Collaborate with internal teams, including media strategy, brand marketing, and SEO to ensure cohesive and integrated marketing strategies.
* Design and implement tests based on best practices within platform, pull and analyze data, and deliver actionable results.
* Adherence to executional excellence is a must; ensure all campaigns follow platform and pharma guidelines while maintaining high standards for quality and compliance.
* Provide assistance with or lead strategy recommendations and discussions for brands in portfolio, taking into account industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies to continuously enhance campaign performance and innovation.
* Lead the daily campaign operations, working closely with other Managers and Sr. Associates to ensure daily checks, pacing, and priority projects are executed.
* Monitor and analyze core metrics, offering insights and actionable recommendations on a monthly and quarterly basis based on optimization logs, auction dynamics, brand nuances, etc.
* Grow the team’s performance, based on pre-defined expectations and goals, and contribute to reaching them.


 QUALIFICATIONS* BA/BS required
* 5+ years of agency or client-side Hands on Keyboard Search expertise (Healthcare experience preferred but not required)
* In-depth knowledge of paid search platforms, including Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, and SA360.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Google Analytics, Adobe, or other analytics tools
* Experience with keyword research, ad copywriting, and landing page optimization
* Ability to manage budgets effectively and demonstrate positive results
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to work effectively and collaboratively in a team-based environment
* Strong communications skills, and ability to translate concepts for a wide variety of audiences
* Understanding of media measurement norms, evolving landscape, and industry standards
* Analytical skills and proficiency in Paid Search tools and analytics platforms

  

  

ADDITIONAL JOB INFORMATION:
Last Date to Apply: September 25, 2024
New York, NY or Collegeville, PA
The annual base salary for this position ranges from $99,900.00 to $166,500.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 15.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.
Marketing and Market Research

title: 1 to 1 Aide
description:
Family Services of Westchester (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. With 50 innovative programs, FSW serves 30,000 individuals annually in Westchester County, New York, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

Founded in 1954, Family Services of Westchester is a private, nonprofit, non-sectarian social services agency.

**Job Details:**

Family Services of Westchester is looking for a 1:1 Aide for our Prime Time program.

**POSITION TITLE**: 1:1 Teacher Aide  
**SALARY:** *$17/hour*  
**STATUS**: Permanent/Full Time  
**SUPERVISED BY**: Head Teacher  
**PURPOSE**: To assist and support the Head Teacher to interpret and implement the Prime-Time program to address the needs of each individual child.  
**WORK LOCATION:** 106 N Broadway, White Plains, NY 10603

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**:

* Assist teacher in the documentation, reflection and planning process to implement the curriculum.
* Assist teacher in providing research-based specialized instruction.
* Build relationships with families and communicate about children's learning and development.
* Partner with the teaching staff and administration.
* Support parents in problem solving.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**:

* CDA and High School Diploma

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 403(b) for full-time employees.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position of Assistant Teacher speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please submit your resume and cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*FSW is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Special education school

Schedule:

* Day shift

Ability to Relocate:

* White Plains, NY 10603: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Associate Director of Nursing
description:
Associate Director of Nursing
**Job Purpose:**
The Associate Director of Nursing (ADON) is a key member of the nursing leadership team.
The ADON is responsible for assisting the Director of Nursing (DON) in planning, developing, organizing, implementing, evaluating and directing the day-to-day functions of the Nursing Department in accordance with established policies, procedures, and practice ensuring that high quality care is provided to the residents. The ADON serves as second in command to the DON, representing the DON as required and assuming the role in the DON’s absence.
**Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Oversees and manages the day-to-day operations of the nursing department, including staffing, scheduling, and resident care.
* Leads the Nursing department’s Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement (QAPI) program.
* Develops and implements nursing care plans, policies, and procedures as needed.
* Ensures that nursing staff is qualified and trained, and that they are providing care in accordance with established standards and regulations.
* Conducts performance evaluations of nursing staff and provides feedback and coaching to improve performance. The ADON oversees disciplinary issues.
* Develops, revises and implements nursing policies and procedures as needed.


* Communicates with families, residents, and physicians as needed.
* Monitors the nursing department budget and ensures that resources are used efficiently.
* Collaborates with ancillary departments to provide comprehensive care to residents.
* Represents the nursing department at meetings and conferences as needed.
* Maintains compliance with all applicable state and federal regulations. Participates in State, Federal and local surveys/inspections.
* Collaborates with the scheduler to ensure that the Department has adequate nursing coverage for every shift.
* Audits patient records to ensure that they are accurate and up to date
* Assists the DON in operationalizing strategic visions across the nursing department.


* Anticipates needs of front-line staff, PCCs, and support staff when managing change.


* Schedules rounds and audits resident treatments and medications to ensure residents are receiving proper care.
* Ensures that all nursing services personnel are performing their respective duties.
* Serves as a resource for the staff regarding the resident’s cognitive and functional abilities.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Requirements:**
* A Master of Nursing preferred and a current Connecticut registration/license as a registered nurse in good standing required.
* Supervisory experience 3-5 years is required.
* Experience of 3-5 years in a long-term care setting is required.
* BCLS certified.
* Strong knowledge of Infection Control/Antibiotic Stewardship practices.
* Strong leadership and management skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Knowledge of State and Federal nursing home regulations.
